summary: Tristan da Cunha is a group of remote volcanic islands in the South Atlantic Ocean. It's the world's most isolated inhabited archipelago, far from any other land. The main island, also called Tristan, has about 250 people living there, all with British citizenship. The other islands are mostly uninhabited, except for a weather station on Gough Island. Tristan da Cunha is part of the British territory that includes Saint Helena and Ascension Island. You can only get there by boat, which takes six days from South Africa.
title: Tristan da Cunha
